name: DEV - PWC version of Luke - Sam

parameters.text:
=You are an AI processor inside an n8n workflow.
Your job is not to behave like an assistant, but prepare an output from the transcript you receive and generate a small structured JSON object that will be inserted into a pre-written PwC weekly client report.

Your output will be consumed by an automated email workflow.
Therefore:

Do not generate prose beyond what is explicitly asked.

Do not invent updates or actions.

Keep everything concise and factual.

Your Tasks
1. Extract the Partner’s High-Level Summary (1–3 sentences)

From the transcript, produce a brief neutral summary describing:

How the CFO/primary client contact reacted

Any material points the Partner raised

Any situational context that would belong in a weekly client file

Do not summarise the Tax or Cyber alerts — those are hard-coded elsewhere.

2. Extract any New Opportunity Mentioned

If the Partner mentions a new opportunity (e.g. acquisition of a port in Rhodes), extract it as one short sentence.

If there is no opportunity mentioned, return an empty string.

3. Extract the Client Name

This will almost always be Meridian Global Shipping, but extract what is actually said.

=Your role is to produce a html formatted version of this text that will be embedded into an html email. I just need the output to be a paragaph of formatted text in html and not a full html template

Text here: {{ $json['0'] }}

parameters.subject: =Meridian Global Shipping – Weekly wrap-up (demo)
parameters.bodyContent:
={{ `
Client Intelligence – Weekly Wrap-Up

Hi Sam,

Below is a sample end-of-week client report for Meridian Global Shipping, generated following your debrief with KAM Engine.

Client: Meridian Global Shipping
Week ending: 4 December 2025
Lead Partner: Sam Stamp

1. This week’s highlights

Finance Enablement Progress
Strong engagement from the CFO and Finance leadership. AI Enablement roadmap validated with minor sequencing adjustments.

Stakeholder Alignment
Clear alignment achieved across Finance, Tax, and Cyber stakeholders on the upcoming phases of the AI programme.

PWC Cross-Service Positioning
Positive feedback from Meridian teams on PwC’s ability to integrate insight across service lines and provide a joined-up client view.

2. Key risks

High Carbon Credits Compliance Risk

Elena has flagged an exposure relating to carbon tax credit treatment for the new fleet. Urgent CFO alignment required to avoid misreporting.

High Cyber Vulnerability – Thessaloniki Port

Marcus’s assessment of the port systems is critical. Prioritised remediation steps recommended immediately.

3. Salesforce / CRM updates

Please forward the table below to salesforce@pwc.com and it will be added to the client file.

Field Value
Account Meridian Global Shipping
Reporting Period Week ending 4 December 2025
Key Contact CFO – Finance & AI Enablement
Relationship Note Positive response to AI Enablement roadmap; alignment achieved across service lines.
Risk – Tax Carbon credit compliance risk flagged; CFO alignment required.
Risk – Cyber Thessaloniki port systems rated critical; remediation planning required.
New Opportunity ${$json.new_opportunity_description || 'No new opportunity recorded this week.'}

4. Fee progress (illustrative)

Example view of budget vs. spend for the current FY.

Budget €500,000
Fees billed to date €320,000
64% of budget used this FY

Best,
KAM Engine
PwC’s Account Management Assistant

` }}

Google Service Account - Edu account Oct 8th

transcript.message: Hello, ready for a quick debrief?
Great. Who was the meeting with?
Got it. And how did the meeting go? What were the key things you want to remember?
Yeah, I want to remember that they've just closed their biggest ever deal and there's definitely an opportunity for us to go in hard with the upsell of our Luke product.
That's fantastic news! So, to confirm, you want to remember that they've just closed their biggest deal ever, and there's a clear opportunity to upsell your Luke product. Is that right?
Thanks. What do you need to do next, and who’s going to take each action?
I need to set up a meeting on the 3rd of December at 11am.
And who will be responsible for setting up that meeting?
Got it. Can you add a bit more detail to make that clearer? For example, who...
transcript.original_message: Got it. Can you add a bit more detail to make that clearer? For example, who should be invited to the meeting?

transcript.message: No I don't have time sorry goodbye.
No problem at all! Glad I could help with capturing those key points. Have a great day!

tool_calls.params_as_json: {"system__message_to_speak": "Thanks for chatting! Take care!", "reason": "User indicated the end of the conversation by saying \"goodbye\" and expressing they don't have time. The agent confirmed understanding and provided a polite closing statement."}

tool_results.result_value: {"result_type":"end_call_success","status":"success","reason":"User indicated the end of the conversation by saying \"goodbye\" and expressing they don't have time. The agent confirmed understanding and provided a polite closing statement.","message":null}

result.reason: User indicated the end of the conversation by saying "goodbye" and expressing they don't have time. The agent confirmed understanding and provided a polite closing statement.

analysis.transcript_summary: The user debriefed with the agent after a meeting with Brian. The key takeaway was that Brian's company closed a major deal, presenting an upsell opportunity for the "Luke" product. The user needs to schedule a follow-up meeting for December 3rd at 11am and will be responsible for this task. The user ended the conversation abruptly.
